member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.BlobInputAttribute
member.summary: Represents an attribute that is used to provide details about how a Windows Azure Blob is bound as a method input parameter. This attribute also serves as a trigger that will run the Job function when a new blob is uploaded. The method parameter type can be a , , , CloudBlob, ICloudBlob, CloudPageBlob, CloudBlockBlob, or a custom type implementing .

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.BlobInputAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the BlobInputAttribute class.
member.param: Path of the blob to bind to. The blob portion of the path can contain tokens in curly braces to indicate a pattern to match. The matched name can be used in other binding attributes to define the output name of a Job function.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.BlobInputAttribute.BlobPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the path of the blob to bind to. The blob portion of the path can contain tokens in curly braces to indicate a pattern to match. The matched name can be used in other binding attributes to define the output name of a Job function.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.BlobOutputAttribute
member.summary: Represents an attribute that is used to provide details about how a Windows Azure Blob is bound as a method input parameter. The method parameter type by default can be a Stream, TextWriter, string (declared as "out"), CloudBlob, ICloudBlob, CloudPageBlob, or CloudBlockBlob.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.BlobOutputAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the BlobOutputAttribute class.
member.param: Path of the blob to bind to. The blob portion of the path can contain tokens in curly braces to indicate a named parameter from an input attribute to substitute.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.BlobOutputAttribute.BlobPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the path of the blob to bind to. The blob portion of the path can contain tokens in curly braces to indicate a named parameter from an input attribute to substitute.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.BindResult.PostActionOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the order in which should be executed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.ICloudBlobStreamBinder`1
member.summary: Defines a custom blob binder.
member.typeparam: The type of object the binder can bind.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.ICloudBlobStreamBinder`1.ReadFromStream(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Binds the content of the blob to a custom type.
member.param: The stream attached to the blob.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.ICloudBlobStreamBinder`1.WriteToStream(`0,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Binds the custom type to the content of the blob.
member.param: The stream to which to write the value.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.IBinder
member.summary: Represents an attribute binder.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.IBinder.Bind``1(System.Attribute)
member.summary: Binds the specified attribute.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.IBinder.AccountConnectionString
member.summary: Gets the Azure Storage connection string.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.PostActionOrder
member.summary: Represents the order in which a bind result post action executes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.QueueOutputAttribute
member.summary: Represents an attribute that is used to provide details about how a Windows Azure Queue is bound as a method output parameter. The method parameter type by default can be either a user-defined type, or a string, or byte array (declared as "out"). To insert multiple messages to a queue use a collections of a supported parameter type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.QueueOutputAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the QueueOutputAttribute class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.QueueOutputAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the QueueOutputAttribute class.
member.param: The name of the queue to bind to. If empty, the name of the method parameter is used as the queue name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.QueueOutputAttribute.QueueName
member.summary: Gets the name of the queue to bind to. If empty, the name of the method parameter is used as the queue name.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.QueueInputAttribute
member.summary: Represents an attribute that is used to provide details about how a Windows Azure Queue is bound as a method input parameter. This attribute also serves as a trigger that will run the Job function when a new message is enqueued. The method parameter type by default can be either a user-defined type, or a string, object, or byte array.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.QueueInputAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the QueueInputAttribute class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.QueueInputAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the QueueInputAttribute class.
member.param: The name of the queue to bind to. If empty, the name of the method parameter is used as the queue name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.QueueInputAttribute.QueueName
member.summary: Gets the name of the queue to bind to. If empty, the name of the method parameter is used as the queue name.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.DescriptionAttribute
member.summary: Represents an attribute that is used to provide a description for a Job function.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.DescriptionAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DescriptionAttribute class with a description.
member.param: The description of the Job function.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.DescriptionAttribute.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the description of the Job function.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.TableAttribute
member.summary: Represents an attribute that is used to provide details about how a Windows Azure Table is bound as a method parameter for input and output. The method parameter type by default can be either an IDictionary<Tuple<string,string>, object> or an IDictionary<Tuple<string,string>, UserDefinedType>. The two properties of the Tuple key represent the partition key and row key, respectively.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.TableAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TableAttribute class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.TableAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TableAttribute class.
member.param: If empty, the name of the method parameter is used as the table name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.TableAttribute.TableName
member.summary: Gets the name of the table to bind to. If empty, the name of the method parameter is used as the table name.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.NoAutomaticTriggerAttribute
member.summary: Represents an attribute that is used to indicate that the JobHost should not listen to this method. This can be useful to avoid the performance impact of listening on a large container or to avoid inadvertent triggering of the function. The method can be invoked explicitly using the Call method on the JobHost.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Jobs.NoAutomaticTriggerAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the NoAutomaticTriggerAttribute class.
